axes.name: Economic Left ↔ Right
axes.description: Taxation, redistribution, and social spending. Positive (+1): Progressive taxation, expanded social services, high redistribution. Negative (-1): Low taxation, minimal state intervention, market-led growth.

axes.name: State Control ↔ Market Economics
axes.description: Role of the state in the economy. Positive (+1): State ownership of key utilities, active regulation, public sector leadership. Negative (-1): Privatisation, deregulation, private sector leadership.

axes.name: Land & Property Rights
axes.description: Land expropriation, communal rights, and land reform pace. Positive (+1): Expropriation without compensation, communal precedence, rapid reform. Negative (-1): Market-rate transactions, private property rights, commercial agriculture.

axes.name: Labour Rights ↔ Market Flexibility
axes.description: Union power, minimum wages, and labour regulation. Positive (+1): Strong unionisation, wage floors, job protection. Negative (-1): Labour flexibility, minimal restrictions, lower wage floors.

axes.name: Law & Order ↔ Civil Liberties
axes.description: State authority, policing, and protest. Positive (+1): Civil liberties prioritised, protest rights, scrutiny of state power. Negative (-1): Strong policing, order prioritised, limits on disruptive protest.

axes.name: Institutional Independence & Governance
axes.description: Independence of judiciary, electoral bodies, and oversight. Positive (+1): Strong institutional autonomy, anti-corruption, good governance, oversight mechanisms. Negative (-1): Political executive flexibility, cadre deployment, centralised control.

axes.name: Environmental Protection ↔ Energy Pragmatism
axes.description: Climate action and energy transition speed. Positive (+1): Aggressive climate targets, rapid renewable transition, restrictions on fossil fuels. Negative (-1): Pragmatic energy mix, coal flexibility, economic prioritisation.

axes.name: Social Progressivism ↔ Conservatism
axes.description: LGBTQ+ rights, gender equality, and cultural liberalism. Positive (+1): Active promotion of progressive values, LGBTQ+ rights, gender equality. Negative (-1): Traditional/conservative values, minimal state intervention in social morality.

axes.name: Global Integration ↔ Economic Nationalism
axes.description: Trade openness, international integration, and immigration. Positive (+1): Global cooperation, open borders, multilateral engagement, free trade. Negative (-1): Economic nationalism, border control, protectionism.

axes.name: Radical Transformation ↔ Incremental Reform
axes.description: Speed and depth of systemic change. Positive (+1): Radical, rapid transformation addressing historical injustices. Negative (-1): Continuity, incremental reform, stability-focused.

axes.name: Public Urban Planning ↔ Market-Led Development
axes.description: Urban form and transit priorities. Positive (+1): Public transport, mixed-use walkability, affordable housing, dense development. Negative (-1): Car-friendly, private property rights, market-led sprawl.

axes.name: Affirmative Action & BEE ↔ Meritocratic Neutrality
axes.description: Employment equity, BEE, and targeted economic support. Positive (+1): Active targeting to address inequality, strong BEE, protected minorities. Negative (-1): Minimal state-mandated targets, colour-blind approaches, merit-based.
